intro: Brachylaena dentata, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in coastal and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white, velvety foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and have serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Brachylaena dentata is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
